thread.title: Updates from Rangers-Blue Jays Game 4

author: Star-Telegram
title: Updates from Rangers-Blue Jays Game 4
text:
Updates from Rangers-Blue Jays Game 4 Rangers starter Derek Holland allowed three runs in the first inning. LM Otero AP i Order Reprint of this Story 
Follow the Star-Telegram ’s writers covering Game 4 of the ALDS. First pitch is at 3:07 p.m. Monday. 
1st innings: Josh Donaldson’s two-run homer on Derek Holland’s fifth pitch of the game gave the Blue Jays a quick 2-0 lead. With two outs, Chris Colabello’s solo homer made it 3-0. In the bottom half, Shin-Soo Choo and Adrian Beltre, a late addition to the Rangers’ lineup, singled with one out. R.A. Dickey, however, got Prince Fielder to fly out to center and Mitch Moreland to pop out to third. Blue Jays 3, Rangers 0. 
2nd inning: Kevin Pillar’s one-out homer to left-center drew a visit from Rangers’ manager Jeff Banister, who appeared to give Holland a pep talk. Dickey retired the side in order, striking out Elvis Andrus and Rougned Odor in the inning. Blue Jays 4, Rangers 0.
